purpleculture_pinyin:
lǐn
cold; to shiver with cold; to tremble with fear; afraid; apprehensive; strict; stern; severe; austere; awe-inspiring; imposing; majestic
холодный; дрожать от холода; дрожать от страха; боюсь; тревожный; строгий; корма; суровый; строгий; внушающий трепет; внушительный; величественный
rtega_mnemonic:
凜凜RS
凛凛		shiver with cold or fear, fearful, cold, imposing
  • the grain in the silo 稟 saves everyone during the fearful cold with ice 冫
purpleculture_info:
(Trad.: 凜)
Pictophonetic: 禀 indicates the sound; 冫 (ice) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
凛冽 [ lǐn liè ]: biting cold
威风凛凛 [ wēi fēng lǐn lǐn ]: majestic; awe-inspiring presence; impressive power
大义凛然 [ dà yì lǐn rán ]: devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
正气凛然 [ zhèng qì lǐn rán ]: awe-inspiring righteousness (idiom)
威风凛冽 [ wēi fēng lǐn liè ]: awe-inspiring (idiom)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 冫 [ bīng ] ice
    • 禀 [ bǐng ] to report to, to petition
heisig_chinese_memo: Much more stately than that soil podium, this is made of chilly ice. You can still see the dude standing behind it in his top hat, and he still spouts pretty much nonsense as many times as he can, but you have to admit his showy altar is quite stately.
WaniKani_Radicals: 冫, 亠, 回, 示
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You're trying to open the lid of a manhole that's covered in ice by jackhammering it a bunch of times but it's not working because it's just too cold. It's so cold that your jackhammer is starting to ice up too. But you need to get this lid open so you try time after time after time!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine if it was sooo cold that no matter how many times you tried to jackhammer the ice of the lid for this manhole, it wouldn't crack open.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Each time the jackhammer hits the freezing cold ice it makes a high pitched ringing (りん) sound. It's actually really annoying to listen to but you really need to crack this ice open so you have to keep listening to it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If it wasn't so darn cold you wouldn't have to hear this horrible high pitched ringing sound because there wouldn't even be any ice to jackhammer through!
Ru_Radicals: 二 (два), 亠 (крышка), 冫 (лёд), 口 (рот), 囗 (коробка), 小 (маленький), 示 (указывать)
Ru_trainchinese: lǐn: (графема) холодный, студеный; строгий, суровый; (книжн.) испуганный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the icy (冫) report (禀) makes you shiver
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Much more stately than that soil podium, this is made of chilly ice. You can still see the dude standing behind it in his top hat, and he still spouts pretty much nonsense as many times as he can, but you have to admit his showy altar is quite stately.

凛字的基本解释

凛
lǐn
寒冷：凛冽。凛凛。
严肃，严正有威势：凛然。凛若冰霜。

凛字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lǐn］
［《廣韻》力稔切，上寢，來。］
亦作“凜1”。亦作“澟1”。
(1)寒冷；冷战。
(2)严肃；庄严。
(3)可敬；畏惧。
(4)同“廩”。积高。参见“凛坎”。

凛字的英文翻译

◎ 凛
afraid, cold, severe, stern, strict

凛字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【冫字部】　凛； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页133第43
【唐韻】力稔切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】力錦切，?音廩。【說文】寒也。【玉篇】凛凛，寒也。【韻會】凄淸也。【集韻】或作?。

凛字的源字形

凛字的起名意思

：直意指寒冷、寒风凛冽。也表示严肃。令人敬畏的样子；凛然正气，威风凛凛。

холодный
Пиктофонетические символы.
Значит, древние иероглифы подобны льду, что означает холод; Линь (лин) - склад для хранения продуктов, который для предотвращения появления плесени от высокой температуры чаще всего строят в прохладном месте.
Первоначальный смысл - холодный.
D холодно: ~ пример | ~ каштан.

Кай
lǐn
Iприл.
1) холодный, студёный; суровый
凛秋暑退 суровая (глубокая) осень; жара отступила
2) суровый, грозный, внушающий страх
其性为凛 грозен его характер
IIгл.
1) дрожать (напр. от холода, страха) ; трепетать
寮属无不凛承 среди подчинённых не было никого, кто не принял бы (приказ) с трепетом
2) вм. 檩 (бояться, страшиться; быть покорным)
Radicals: 冫, 亠, 回, 示  (ice, lid, times, jackhammer)
Meaning Mnemonic
You're trying to open the lid of a manhole that's covered in ice by jackhammering it a bunch of times but it's not working because it's just too cold. It's so cold that your jackhammer is starting to ice up too. But you need to get this lid open so you try time after time after time!
Imagine if it was sooo cold that no matter how many times you tried to jackhammer the ice of the lid for this manhole, it wouldn't crack open.
Reading Mnemonic
Each time the jackhammer hits the freezing cold ice it makes a high pitched ringing (りん) sound. It's actually really annoying to listen to but you really need to crack this ice open so you have to keep listening to it.
If it wasn't so darn cold you wouldn't have to hear this horrible high pitched ringing sound because there wouldn't even be any ice to jackhammer through!
